BiblioData.Title: ENHANCING PERFORMANCE CHARACTERISTICS OF ORGANIC SEMICONDUCTING FILMS BY IMPROVED SOLUTION PROCESSING

Applicant.Name: UNIV CALIFORNIA [US]
THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA

BiblioData.Abstract: Improved processing methods for enhanced properties of conjugated polymer films are disclosed, as well as the enhanced conjugated polymer films produced thereby. Addition of low molecular weight alkyl-containing molecules to solutions used to form conjugated polymer films leads to improved photoconductivity and improvements in other electronic properties. The enhanced conjugated polymer films can be used in a variety of electronic devices, such as solar cells and photodiodes.

Claims.P: CLAIMS
What is claimed is:

1. A method of increasing the photoconductivity, charge transport, solar energy conversion efficiency, or photovoltaic efficiency of an organic semiconductor film, comprising the steps of adding an amount of one or more low molecular weight alkyl- containing molecules to a solution of one or more organic semiconductors, and forming the organic semiconductor film from the solution, wherein the low molecular weight alkyl- containing molecules are selected from the group consisting Of C1-C20 alkanes substituted with one or more substituents selected from aldehyde, dioxo, hydroxy, alkoxy, thiol, thioalkyl, carboxylic acid, ester, amine, amide, ether, thioether, halide, fluoride, chloride, bromide, iodide, nitrile, epoxide, aromatic, and arylalkyl groups, with the proviso that if a thiol or hydroxy group substituent is present, at least one independently chosen additional substituent must also be present, and with the proviso that di-halo substituted compounds are excluded from the low molecular weight alkyl-containing molecules.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the organic semiconductor film comprises a conjugated polymer film.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the low molecular weight alkyl-containing molecules are selected from C1-C20 alkanes substituted with at least one hydroxy group and at least one thiol group.
4. The method of claim 3, wherein the one or more low molecular weight alkyl- containing molecules are selected from Ci-C20 dithioalkanes.
5. The method of claim 4, wherein the Ci-C20 dithioalkanes are alpha, omega- substituted.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the low molecular weight alkyl-containing molecules are selected from Ci-C20 iodoalkanes.
7. The method of claim 2, wherein the forming of the conjugated polymer film from the solution is performed by spin-casting.

8. The method of claim 1 , wherein the one or more low molecular weight alkyl- containing molecules is present in the solution used to form the conjugated polymer film in an amount of about 0.1% to about 10% v/v.
9. The method of claim 1, wherein the organic semiconductor film comprises a conjugated polymer film electron donor and an organic electron acceptor.
10. The method of claim 9, wherein the conjugated polymer film electron donor and organic electron acceptor form a bulk heterojunction.

11. The method of claim 9, wherein the conjugated polymer film electron donor comprises a polymer selected from polyacetylene, a polyphenylene, poly(3-alkylthiophenes) where alkyl is from 6 to 16 carbons (P3AT's), poly-(3-hexylthiophene) (P3HT), poly[2,6- (4,4-bis-(2-ethylhexyl)-4H-cyclopenta[2,l-b;3,4-b']-dithiophene)-[alpha]/t-4,7-(2,l,3- benzothiadiazole)] (PCPDTBT), polyphenylacetylene, polydiphenylacetylene, polyanilines, poly(p-phenylene vinylene) (PPV) and alkoxy derivatives thereof, poly(2-methoxy,5-(2'- ethyl-hexyloxy)-p-phenylenevinylene) (ME[Eta]-PPV), poly(2,5-dimethoxy-p-phenylene vinylene) (PDMPV), a polythiophene, a poly(thienylenevinylene), poly(2,5- thienylenevinylene), a polyporphyrin, a porphyrinic macrocycle, a thiol-derivatized polyporphyrin, a polymetallocene, a polyferrocene, a polyphthalocyanine, a polyvinylene, a polyphenylvinylene, a polysilane, a polyisothianaphthalene, or a polythienylvinylene, or a derivative of one or more of the foregoing materials, or a blend or combination of two or more of the foregoing materials in any proportion.
12. The method of claim 9, wherein the organic electron acceptor comprises a fullerene derivative.
13. The method of claim 12, wherein the fullerene derivative is selected from compounds of the formula:

where "fullerene" is independently selected from a C60, C70, or C84 fullerene moiety, Ar is independently phenyl or thienyl, which can be unsubstituted or substituted, Ri is independently Ci-Q2 alkyl, and R2 is independently -0-Ci-Ci2 alkyl or -0-Ci-Ci2 alkyl-SH.
14. The method of claim 13, wherein the fullerene derivative is selected from C61- PCBM or C71 -PCBM.

15. The method of claim 1, wherein the solvent used in the solution is chlorobenzene, dichlorobenzene, trichlorobenzene, benzene, toluene, chloroform, dichloromethane, dichloroethane, xylenes, [alpha],[alpha],[alpha]-trichlorotoluene, methyl naphthalene, chloronaphthalene, or mixtures thereof.

16. An electronic device comprising a first electrode, an organic semiconductor film having a first side and a second side, where the first side of the organic semiconductor film contacts the first electrode and where the film is formed by adding an amount of one or more low molecular weight alkyl-containing molecules to a solution used to form the organic semiconductor film, and a second electrode contacting the second side of the organic semiconductor film, wherein the low molecular weight alkyl-containing molecules are selected from the group consisting of Ci-C20 alkanes substituted with one or more substituents selected from aldehyde, dioxo, hydroxy, alkoxy, thiol, thioalkyl, carboxylic acid, ester, amine, amide, ether, thioether, halide, fluoride, chloride, bromide, iodide, nitrile, epoxide, aromatic, and arylalkyl groups, with the proviso that if a thiol or hydroxy group substituent is present, at least one independently chosen additional substituent must also be present, and with the proviso that di-halo substituted compounds are excluded from the low molecular weight alkyl-containing molecules.
17. The device of claim 16, wherein the organic semiconductor film comprises a conjugated polymer film.
18. The device of claim 16, wherein the electronic device is a solar cell, photovoltaic cell, photodetector, photodiode, or phototransistor.
19. The device of claim 16, wherein the first electrode is a high work function material.
20. The device of claim 16, wherein the second electrode is a low work function material.
